Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cordial”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Easy to find and in a good location. Room was adequate although disappointed with the en-suite. There was no cubicle around the shower so the whole bathroom got wet. Query health and safety - there was a hairdryer in the bathroom. Breakfast was okay although not as advertised. (Advert said warm rolls baked on the premises - we were served pre-packed rolls from the supermarket). Most staff were friendly and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: cliff1608
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam !!!! What a fun place. Stayed two nights in Hotel Cordial, it's ok. Nothing special, everything we expected really, it's clean and tidy (though being renovated at mo so front covered in scaffold) rooms basic but good enough for a couple of nights, breakfast was fine (though after nights before couldn't face it). But what this hotel has is a perfect location, just past Dam Square and excellently situated for lots of fun. Everything we wanted was within a 5mins walk, bars, attractions, museums, red light district and even a friendly out of the way coffee shop down an alley just behind it. We'll definatley visit Amsterdam again and would stay in hotel cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Vile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beej186337
Reviews.Content: The only tip I have to people thinking of going here is - Don't. I would not stay there if someone paid me. The only reason I haven't rated sleep quality and location is because I wasn't there long enough. Rooms were inhabitable. This should not be advertised on any booking website. Dust. Rust. Stains. No curtains, and busy workmen constantly looking in. See all the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Wost place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CTB192
Reviews.Content: Where to begin,.. First you receive a confirmation in Dutch, but when arriving at the hotel they only speak English. Politeness is far far away. Once arriving in the room the bad surprises keep on coming, a tiny room with two separate beds. A desk which is in pieces and about to collapse any time. Holes in the wall a tiny sink in the middle of the room with a mirror. No outside view due to current restoration works of the facade. Paper thin walls, you can hear everything from your neighbors. And then a very tiny bathroom, actually just a big toilet with a shower installed. This hotel is really overpriced and not even worth to have stars... ETAP hotels are as well basic but much better in terms of quality...

Reviews.Title: “shank in center”
Reviews.Author: Andrey L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi to everyone! the hotel is barely can be called 3 star hotel. Room stinks, the walls are way to thin so you can hear and feel what is around you. do not order breakfast it is nothing. If price for room will be 35-40 euro - in that case it is ok, buy over it is a robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: ArmHotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed on January 2012. Beds were not so bad, as were written in previous reviews. Location is good, near to Dam Square. 10 minutes walk to Centraal station. Breakfast was the same every day.

Reviews.Title: “No bed bugs seen”
Reviews.Author: Elvaf S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of December 2011 with seven 60+ year olds who like their comfort. Having read about the bed bugs from numerous reviewers we were quite nervous about what we would find (almost brought our Marigolds!). The first thing we did on arrival was to check our mattresses carefully. Our fears were unfounded as we did not encounter any bed bugs in any of the five rooms we had on the 3rd floor. Two of our party were allocated a very small, dark room but the lovely receptonist Ross changed us to a more spacious room. He was also most helpful with any queries we had. (I think with this hotel it depends on the type of room you are allocated.) By the way the beds were most comfortable. Yes, the hotel is very run down but for the price and very central location it was OK. Two of our party were at the front of the hotel and were woken each morning at seven by the ongoing work in the street. The others were at the back and could only vaguely hear any noise. We spent most of our time seeing Amsterdam so really we only slept there. Breakfast was adequate. I think this hotel would be more suited to young people on a limited budget who are more prepared to put up with 'little' inconveniences. Perhaps on our next visit to Amsterdam we will go for an upgrade hotel as we 'golden oldies' do like our comfort but our holiday was in no way spoiled by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs, terrible service, worst value for money in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: runesb
Reviews.Content: Reports of bed bugs are true. If you read this after prepaid your stay there either bring an insecticide treated mosquitonet to sleep on or take the loss and choose a different hotel. We did the former and were spared. The receptionist greeted us by pretending to throw a foldable chair at us and acted either extremely energetic or indifferent. He knew of the bed bug problem but said there are worse hotels in Amsterdam. Not a great comfort. At the price level you cannot do worse in Amsterdam. Didnt dare trying the included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Ian1999
Reviews.Content: Tiny, overpriced room. They took the money before I'd acutally stopped there! Badly needs soundproofing! There is a building site outside, the continual noise of trams and a nightclub nearby open until 3.00am! Breakfast choice is pathetic. Worst of all there is an infestation of bedbugs and I was badly bitten. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Threadbare,tired,tiny room,uneven service and bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: av man.
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune recently to stay here for nine nights.My company booked it primarily for its location,being a 5 minute walk to the Ajax Experience in Rembrandt splien,where i was working.Rokin is a main thoroughfare with trams,drunks,and an italian establishment that was noisy and stayed open until 3 in the morning.In addition to the trams and drunks,they are also building a metro line and construction starts at 7am.No A/C ,so you really had to leave the windows open to avoid suffocating in the small space.So far,so good,given room 202,opened the outward-opening door,if it was inward -opening it would have hit the bed.Wall light wasn't working but the small bedside one was,i discovered that there was no bulb in the first one.The room would have delighted a monk but it was a tad on the small side at 2:7m square.The en-suite was ok, but the loo roll holder was either too difficult ,or too time consuming to reload,so the loo roll was left balanced on top of it.(see photo).There was no sink plug either,this would make shaving quite an adventure,however a new one was fitted.The shower head had more water squirting backwards than was coming out of the front.A new one was procured at the front desk and i fitted it myself.Every night ,coming back here,was a voyage of discovery,some nights i got a towel and a bath mat,other nights ,i got one or the other!There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room,the management clearly not wanting to encroach on the coffee shops territory!The breakfast room was ok with plentiful tea,coffee,eggs,rolls,cheeses and meats,no yoghurt or fruit though.Stair carpets were threadbare and the corridors were poorly lit, giving the place a gloomy, tired feeling. On my last night,i was looking out my flight details and happened to look at page two of the booking.com papers and discovered that the company had booked me a twin room and the hotel had put me in the monks' cell single.I went down to the desk to quiz the man who had given me the room the previous saturday, and he gave me some story about the twin not being much bigger than the single and even showed me room pictures on the hotel web site,he did concede that i would have been more comfortable in the twin.My own fault for not looking at the booking properly,but i suspect that it was deliberate action by the hotel to extract as much as they could get for their tawdry rooms, as there was a big convention in town that weekend ,and as i was on my own ,they put me in a single to free up a twin.Shabby treatment,but no more than i would expect from this tired enterprise.It does have one redeeming feature and that is it's location.Avoid at all costs,oh yes,i forgot to mention the bedbugs ,but others before me have already pointed that out.Free wi-fi in reception only.Cost for 9 nights,on a sliding scale 499 euros on sat,139 on sunday,219 on monday,159 on tues,89 on wed,89 on thursday,149 on friday,189 on sat,and 89 on sunday,total 1621 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy and bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Artem C
Reviews.Content: Keep attention with their beds - i was bitten by angry bugs. Did not visit a doc yet, so I don't know if they infected me with something. But stings looks rather unattractive.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced but location was good”
Reviews.Author: Beks1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, at the time of booking we asked for a double room but on arrival got a twin room with 2 beds just pushed together! (i think all the rooms appear to have single beds in) Room was very small and dark, the lighting was poor. The shower was broken. Breakfast was included in the price and was ok. The staff were friendly. Location was great, very close to the shops, bars, cafes and 10 mins walk to train station. Overall we thought it was too over priced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “"If not for its great location ..."”
Reviews.Author: marion1228
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the last stop of our European vacation last year. We booked this hotel located at Rokin online and though it was near the Dam Square, it was a bit far from Centraal station. Good thing you can take the tram coz it was quite a walk. We got the standard room and it was small with no windows! I was surprised coz the rate per night wasn't cheap, it was a bit pricey so I felt there should be windows at least haha...Good thing we aren't the claustrophic type. The hallways and the stairs leading to the rooms were a bit scary for me because of poor lighting but once you get used to it, its ok. The breakfast buffet was ok , the usual stuff but not as extensive as the other hotels we've stayed in. They have free internet at the lobby and the receptionist was friendly and helpful. But the great thing about this hotel is that it is located at the back of Kalver Straat, an entire street of shops !!!! We discovered it by accident , we were shopping and checking out all the stores ( they have the European labels mixed with local brands ) and decided to cross an alley and we ended up in front of the hotel... No wonder it charges quite a fee per night, it's right smack in the shopping district! You can shop and bring back your stuff back to your room and shop again. It was a pleasant surprise indeed so we kinda didn't mind anymore if the room was small because the location's accessibility made up for it, in some ways.

Reviews.Title: “Phone went missing!!! No help from the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Aeriha
Reviews.Content: I forgot my phone at the hotel,called 1h after I left to tell them.The phone was never found and I know where I left it! Tried to call, tried to email, was not answered, got hung up! Don't go there, your valuable stuff will get missing and you won't get anyhelp after that!! Never got a bad service like that, my first bad review ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: licketylips
Reviews.Content: Great location in middle of city, not far from Dam, train station, red light district and shopping area. Breakfast was included, free wifi and 24 hr reception. Good value overall for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stupidly expensive and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: SarahMarkw
Reviews.Content: Stupidly Expensive, I have stayed in 5* hotels in London and Windsor for far less and had luxury at every level. Whilst the bed were clean and comfy the rooms and hotel itself were really really dirty and shabby, wallpaper peeling off and piles of dust everywhere. The breakfast is also poor. The only thing going for this hotel is location - 2 minutes from Dam Square!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ROOM 10 HAS A BAD BED BUG INFESTATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: MtlFam
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 24 hrs after arriving at Schiphol early in the morning. We spent lotsof time in the room. When we came back from dinner noticed a sweet musty smell in the room with a hint of fres Tobacco. My wife opened a window and saw a bug crawling on the bed. She thought it crawled in from the window. The next morning we woke up at 11am and the kids beds were crawling with bugh plus many blood spots on their sheets. My bed had none spotted in it but i am the one with all the bite marks. They are in rows of three and typical of bed bug marks shown in google images. 30% of people don't react and the other 3 members of my family seem to be in this category. The manager appropriately agreed to refund our money and let us move to another hotel. They did charge us for the night we stayed. I am awake now early writing this and pondering whether to use steroids or antihistamines to counteract the itching. My face scalp shoulders and legs are severely marked at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Mice”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl991
Reviews.Content: Not kidding. Mice. We watched one run through the lobby toward the dining area. Also, hideous service from the creepy owner and a filthy room. Do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant average hotel”
Reviews.Author: geyan
Reviews.Content: Location was very good, next the the dam, easy to find, good distance from everything. Beds were very comfy! Breakfast was average, lady who served it was very nice! Windows opened, which was useful. Internet available at the reception, really handy. Staff were kind! Only downside would be the amount of stairs, waiting for the lift took a bit of time, also the bathroom had a slight funny smell, but nothing you couldn't get over! But overall pretty decent, can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: TonyHFG
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. Room was small and the noise from the front street was loud and constant all night, but the room and the bed were clean and tidy - no sign of any bedbugs that others have posted about. The guy on reception was a little over-familiar, but friendly enough. Breakfast was basic but ok, though no full-english option I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Umm, OK but don't go expecting the ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Randall_Flagg123
Reviews.Content: For a group of friends going to enjoy all that amsterdam has to offer its ideal. For a family i wouldn't! We found our room to be clean, hygenic, not noisy and everything worked, thats really all you can ask for at this hotel and price paid. All i would say is just remember how much you've paid per night before complaining about the little things like dirty windows! Positives - Great location, 24 hour reception, clean sheets and towels, good prices on rooms. Negatives - Room was tired, well the one we were in was, but doable. Biggest gripe was the breakfast, just a real lack of selection really, which leaves you with the obvious impression that the hotel is tight and couldn't care less. Stayed in many hotels, many two stars and the selection here is by far the worst and the cheapest quality possible. Sweet orange squash instead of juice and really thick uht milk to name the worst of it. Really wouldn't cost much in the great scheme of things to supply more of a selection, maybe cereals, toast, including something healthly as nothing available was, LIKE FRUIT! Lets start with fruit!! and go from there....

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL CORDIAL HAS BEDBUGS!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2TRAVEL60795
Reviews.Content: CORDIAL HOTEL HAS BEDBUGS!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE! My friend and I realized that there were bedbugs in the bed after 1 night sleep. We demanded to speak to the owner, Mr. Chen, who denied being the owner, refused to give us a refund for the evening, and only transferred to his other hotel for the remainder of our stay. He also then claimed that we brought the bedbugs with us!! We had to spend an entire day of our trip doing laundry. GETTING BEDBUGS was bad enough, but dealing with this hotelâ€™s management was the worst experience ever!!!! There are better hotels for the money- it's NOT WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “Caution!”
Reviews.Author: megal97
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute due to being stranded in Amsterdam due to unforeseen circumstances, booked online without reading any reviews (foolish I know!). Please take note of the negative reviews about this hotel they are all correct and not just from 'fussy' travelers. I did not expect the Ritz - however a basic hygiene standard I do expect, the hotel was dirty, damp and smelly, the staff were miserable, there was constant noise all through the night from other guests and trams outside. Other than the location this hotel has not much to offer, we moved hotels to a much nicer quieter and cheaper hotel near the central station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, budgeted hotel and bad service”
Reviews.Author: Hami80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. after ariving we came to know that the lift is not working and we had to carry our own luggage. The owner and the receptionist are not at all helpful. Its a old hotel and lot of noice from the steet is disturbing. the breakfast was ok .

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.........”
Reviews.Author: vjmcdonnell
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a stag and location is great. Room was clean but matress felt like it was [--]. No major issues, open all night so access not a problem. I'd stay again but only if with lads. Not somewhere I'd bring the wife. Price is expensive but its right in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “What a slum”
Reviews.Author: Dubdude1
Reviews.Content: A terrible, terrible hotel. It really is a disgrace that this place is still trading. No room to swing a cat and if you had a cat, they wouldn't live in this filth. The hotel felt reasonably safe and the statff were courteous but unfortunately they were let down by the diabolical standard of the "hotel". A toilet directly under the shower head in a room nit much bigger thatn a telephhone box is not my idea of an enjoyable place to holiday! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Was almost put off by previous unfair reviews-but was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Joannebo
Reviews.Content: Read some very negative reviews about this hotel. We found it to be central, clean, value for money, and there was a lift to all floors .Granted the rooms are small but adequate for a short break. Having stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam this one is in a better league. The continental breakfast was well presented, the shower was hot, the beds comfy and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel with brek included...”
Reviews.Author: Pauly_86
Reviews.Content: Great location on rokin just past damrak with is a plus point, its not too busy outside like staying in the red light district and close to dam square. Staff were nice, rooms small basic and kinda dated but we were no expecting much as paid 60 pound a night for the room. Breakfast was breads, meats cheese and buscuits, tee and coffee, very basic but fills a hole. you get what u pay for and this was kinda cheap but if ur out all day quality doesnt really matter. Did get a great 2 nights sleep evan tho we had a main street facing our window. supermarkets and food shops real close but expensive. Tip find a lidl and stock up as its 2.50 euro for a drink !!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for within a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: caramelcookie101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with a partner. Directions on the website are spot on and you quickly notice that you could even walk from the train station. A really good location to get about anywhere on foot or tram. Everything inside the hotel is basic but considering how much you pay for, I was happy with it. Rooms were clean and all the surfaces. Duvet covers too rough for my liking though. Staff are friendly and there is someone there 24 hours which comforting. I would stay again because the purpose of my trip was to sightsee and explore, the little time I'm staying in a hotel, this is just right for what I need.

Reviews.Title: “Bad room great location”
Reviews.Author: GlassyGlussyLTD
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not seem to bad from first look, but once you got to your room then that's when it goes down hill. My room which I was staying in (HAD NO VIEW just a wall with other ROOMS not pleasing to see), was shared by my two friends the beds where ok as standards go but no room to walk around, no coffee/tea facilites, you had to go down to recieption. Unlimited use of towel because we where next to the storeroom where we helped ourselves due to the wet room (bathroom) soaking up the floor of the bathroom. Because the weather was so hot the hotel could not provide us with fans and the rooms had no air-conditioning. So overal the location of this hotel is great walking distance to all major attraction, no need for trams unless your a lazzy person. great bars, was the when Holland beat Brazil 2-1 great atmosphere, but hotel could improve alot.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Koby11
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at Cordial. The hotel is located at Rockin St. 100 meters from Dam Square... The room was kinda small. breakfast was ok. the internet was not working during my stay. The receptionists were very nice. if you're not spoiled, it will be good choice.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, noisy, impolitness of the desk clerck”
Reviews.Author: SergioDesmo
Reviews.Content: we had the rooms 104,204,304,404 directly on the street. the rooms were so small, the furnitures directly coming from the middle age, the shower had mushrooms between the ceramics, no swith button worked in the bathroom, a terrible smell either of urine or wet or detergent, couldn't tell. the noise isolation of the windows was so bad I thought the windows were opened. One of my female colleague was so scared that we moved her out to another hotel as it looks like more a hotel for junkies and prostitution than a real hotel. Bed sheets were clean to my surprise. if you pay using your credit card, the guy charges you 3% on top of the bill which will not show the final billed price ! The guy at the desk counter is rude and very arrogant. zero services. no internet in the rooms. I promised myself to do that comment on tripadvisor as this is a pure scandal to call that an hotel and bill 85 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP -- negative reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: Itinerant_scholar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me, and for a colleague, by others. It is a disgrace, and the people running it know so. And they don't care. I spent half a day and then, late and night, moved on to another hotel (read on to find out why). Problems? Tiny, badly-arranged room, few lights (those that were there radiated darkness). Bed linens that did not smell clean. No soap or toiletries, two worn-out towels, no telephone (despite elaborate instructions on how to call from room to room), no remote for the small TV (stand up really tall and reach up to punch buttons on top of the set, hung high on the wall; they may or may not do what you want, because you can't see what they are). Internet didn't work and the guys at the desk didn't seem at all bothered by that. Two things really got to me: the toilet leaked all over the floor, from the bottom of the fixture, whenever I flushed it; I asked to be put into another room, but was told they had none. Lots of keys sitting idle in their boxes, but those people were all "out of the hotel". But they'd have it fixed by the time I came back from dinner. Did they -- of course not. The topper, and I'll admit this may be a matter of my own personal reactions: in the breakfast room, in a hotel where they serve no other meals, three or four large families were having dinner, with people from those groups moving around the lobby in clearly proprietary ways. It would be no problem (Lord knows) if the staff and owners of the joint were running a decent hotel in order to feed several families. But in fact they were ripping us off, and depriving us of hotel basics, in order to do that, and I just can't get away from the feeling of being exploited in many ways. All of those dubious pleasures cost 107 Euros -- yes, Amsterdam is expensive, but on a busy Saturday night (Ajax playing a big international match) I found a *far* better room, for a lower rate, in a hotel less than five minutes' walk away. STAY AWAY from the Cordial -- best advice I can give -- Quel sac des puces...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CornlTraveller2
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have had the misfortune to stay in. Dirty, dismal and depressing would be the best description. Mould growing on and wallpaper peeling off the walls. Curtains that hadn't been washed since the day they were hung. Holes and stains in the bed covers. An offensive smell in the bathroom that no amount of disinfectant or airfreshener could combat. 24 hour bar seems to mean it's not open for 24 hours a day. Maid service - well it was three days before they even made the beds! Some of the reception staff were quite aggressive and had clearly not attended the customer service course!! On a serious note - there were quite a number of health and safety issues - poor lighting,no emergency lighting, broken sockets and light switches to name but a few. We were staying with another couple and between us spent a lot of money just staying out of the place as it was so uncomfortable and unwelcoming. So if you are heading for Amsterdam don't stay here - after a hard days sightseeing you deserve a bit of comfort not squalor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - but Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Franklyn25
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends for 3 nights at the Cordial Hotel, I must admit that It couldn't have been any better located we hardly needed to use any public transport, but apart from that there is room for improvement; Location - As already mentioned Gr8! Staff - 2 out of the four receptionists we met were unbelievably rude and arrogant I have ever come accross!!! Once we returned to our room at 2am, and to our surprise we found the hotel locked, we rang the bell so that someone would open but unfortunately no one came, I had to call my friends who were sleeping to come down and try to find the receptionist!! after 10 mins waiting in the cold outside the hotel the receptionist came with an angry look on his face!!! As if it was not enough he slammed my hotel key against the reception counter!!! Do u believe it!?? Rooms - Very Small, but I didn't expect any better. One thing which they did not mention was that our bathroom was outside the room!! and not ensuite! On the other hand the rooms were clean. Breakfast - Very Basic, some rolls, ham & Cheese and a boiled agg but again I didn't expect better. Value - It was very cheap, therefore I would still recomend it for someone travelling on budget!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel apart from the bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Majorcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cordial early October 2009. The location is great being just down from Dam Square so it was really easy to get around. We booked a basic double room with ensuite online and when we were checking in 2 men asked about prices for a room which was pretty much the same as ours. The manager answered them in Italian (presumably because we were speaking english and he thought we would not understand) and offered them a significantly lower price than we had paid. When we asked him about it he looked embarrased and said that it was a room in a different part of the hotel and that we probably wouldn't like it, ours was much better. hmmm. It seems that you will get a much better deal at this hotel if you walk in, or maybe call, instead of booking online. The room was ok. The bedspread was dirty, stained, and smelled bad, so i took it to the maid and she gave me a cleaner one. The sheets seemed to be clean. We stayed here for 3 nights when we left I was left with several large and painful bug bites on my neck and back which lasted about 5 days. I told the manager and he asked me what I wanted him to do about it. I asked him to point me in the direction of the nearest pharmacy please and recommended that maybe they have someone come round and fumigate the room before putting any more guests in there. He was polite enough, although he didnt seem to think that the bed bugs were to much of a big deal. Other than that the hotel was nice enough and quiet. The breakfast was pretty reasonable too. If they address the bed bug problem then it's not a bad place to stay. I probably wouldn't recommend it to a friend due to the bed bug thing.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvanroon
Reviews.Content: Just back from mid-week (3 night) stay in Amsterdam. This hotel was booked as a fourth option as the previous 3 other options were not available. So as a basic 2 star hotel I was not expecting more than a clean basic hotel and as a solo traveller I never expect outstanding service. However, after checking in to my room I found that the ceiling light in the bathroom was hanging down exposing the wires and that the ceiling tiles in the bathroom were stained indicating that there had been a big leak on the floor above in the past. The wash basin was also chipped and cracked plus the shower head had a calcite build up indicating that they were either not cleaned regularly or sanitised. The main sleeping area (excluding the bathroom & entrance) would be no bigger than 8ft x 6ft which incorporated the bed, table & wardrobe cabinet. This cabinet had a thick layer of dust ontop of it that must have been untouched for at least 2 months. The bed linen (top sheet) had major holes at the bottom of the bed which you could not miss and the main blanket had scorch marks either from matches or cigarettes. Plus the rom had a musty smell to it. The only things the hotel had going for it was its central locality to all sites (shopping & museums) and it's very efficient and good breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly small for an American tourist.”
Reviews.Author: storyimage
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location but it was so small, especially for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Bear78
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were very pleasent and efficent. We had made prior arrangements to check in early as we had arrived on a morning flight. The reception area was clean and provided free internet access. The room itself along with the shower room / toilet was small, basic and a little outdated but nonetheless clean. The Hotel is in an excellent location less than two minutes walk to Dam Square. From here you are perfectly situated to explore the city at your leasure or join one of the many tours that operate in the area. It's an excellent Hotel to base yourself from and very reasonably priced but just don't expect "The Ritz".

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: CMcKenzie1404
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel whilst attending the Holland v Scotland match. HAving read the reviews on this site I wasn't looking forward to staying there. How wrong I was. We arrived at about 10 30 and 3 out of the 4 rooms were ready. Check in was simple enough and it was up to our rooms to await what we thought was mise infested corridors. Saw absolutely nothing. The rooms are very simple so don't book expecting luxury. Bed was very comfortable and a smart looking LCD tv on the wall. It does get noisy with the tram line running outside hotel though. The toilet is a wet room which isn't massive but enough room for 1 person. I didn't make it to breakfast but was informed that it was edible but nothing special. We arrived back at the hotel at about 2am both nights and had no trouble getting back in. A computer in the main reception area allows free internet access. Overall this is a hotel with a fantastic location and not overly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night, as it was reduced in price. Upon arrival a very friendly chap booked us in. The lift is ancient and a bit temperamental (doors didn't always open before left departed to next floor) Our room was quite small and dated, but the bed was very comfy. The shower room was tiny, to have a shower you would have had to sit on the wc nearly... also old fashioned. We went out and came back at 1.30am, to our alarm the front door was locked and no staff member in sight. We rang the doorbell for 10 minutes getting more worried and cold. Eventually the staff member appeared, he said he had been in the 'Boiler Room' , however from the smell we deduced he must have been having a sit down in the little boys room. Its centrally located near Dam Square and Rembrandts plein etc. The street is very noisy, even though we were on 5th floor the trams and other street noise were very loud and the curtains were thin so it was bright. The breakfast was fine. Overall because we got the room cheap it was worth the money but would not be worth the usual price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: funkeeslave
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the hotel after all the terrible reviews. However It was the most fun I have ever had on holiday. The staff were very,very friendly and were good fun. The rooms were small and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: americangirl555
Reviews.Content: We were overcharged twice, and then actually locked into the lobby so they could shout profanities at us when we disputed the charge. I wish I knew who to report the whole incident to, but we just paid an extra 150 euros so they would let us out of the hotel. Scary.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely central”
Reviews.Author: travelgrumpy
Reviews.Content: For a night in Amsterdam, we dediced we wanted a cheapish hotel in the centre. After an internet search we found this hotel. We checked in, and got told that we were allowed to bring 'guests' back to the room. Kind of strange, but he ho, we are in Amsterdam. The room was very basic, and not very big. The bathroom was oke, could be better maintained. We went out in Amsterdam for the evening, and the hotel is prefectly located for this. After a basic night sleep, we had breakfast, which actually is better than the room, basic but sufficient. Checking out went without problems, all in all value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoshNL
Reviews.Content: Guys, I'm Dutch and know Dutch/Amsterdam standard hotels/prices... This hotel (at least the room they gave us) was way below standard. The room was right on the stairway in front of the lift, very noisy.. we're not offended by noise though but would bother the noise-sensitives. The room was dirty, damp, white TL lights, very small, beds overused, soft and uncomfartable, bed linen very dirty, full of stains and holes and stinking (we slept with our clothes on, on a july night just to avoid skin contact with the bed linen), bathroom out-of-date from the 80's standard white tile walls and the most annoying was the day after, all the itch and bite spots from the bugs... Paid 90 Euros per night per room, and believe me, there are much much better places to stay even cheaper.. The room size is small, but if that was the only problem i wouldn't mind at all... PS: We booked for two nights but left after the first night simply because we couldn't stay there any minute longer, had no refunds, and booked another hotel for the second night, very close, cleaner and even a few euros cheaper.... I would never ever ever go back and i'd think twice if i were you before booking here...

Reviews.Title: “hated the hotel cordial”
Reviews.Author: JoeyB53
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were pleasent and helpful. The room was old, outdate carpet, bed, bedspread and filthy. The place was terribly noisy and sort of scary. Did not feel safe at all. The shower had no shower stall or curtain. The water just runs directly onto the tile floor with a drain!!! Very convenient to stand under the shower head and pee directly into the toilet next to you. My wife cried when she saw the room and refused to get undressed and slept on the bed in her clothes. We desided to get up at 5 AM so we could get out of this overpriced dump ($200) ASAP. The only bright spot was the very helpful front desk folks.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mirvera
Reviews.Content: just perfect, i've spent in this hotel 4 nights and it couldn't have been better, at the beginning i wasn't sure about my decision but then again i just needed a clean, small room to spend a few days in the "last free city of planet earth", i wasn't with family or girlfriend so i did not have much to risk. During these 4 days i had the chance to meet the guys who run the place, and they were all very friendly and easygoing, expecially Mario, a great guy who was always willing to help. The rooms are small, no doubt about it, but i can assure that they're clean and confortable, i even had a small plasma tv with cable channell, and considering that it's a budget hotel, i'd say it's incredible.I had a room in the back side of the building so the view from the room was very poor (and i've been told that from Mario when i arrived, so he's been honest) but i could sleep peacefully like a baby without noise; there are also room on the front side, and they have a great view on one of the main strip, but ovviously could be noisy... Never had breakfast so i don't really know, but nobody was complaining about it so i guess it was good. The hotel is 10min walking to anywhere so i never had to take a taxi and that helped a lot since taxi are incredible expensive in Amsterdam. To make a lontg story short, this is the best budget hotel i've ever been to and i would definately suggest it to every easygoing, well-natured person who wants to live Amsterdam as a friend of the city and not as a snob tourist. Thanks to Mario and to the staff

Reviews.Title: “sooo much noise!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: legend333
Reviews.Content: on arrival at the hotel we had the feeling that it was going to be rather nice, the front office is all decorated in marble stone and the reception staff were initially very helpful and friendly.... needless to say this didn't last!!!! when we got to our room we found it to be slightly dated and in need of work considering we had a MASSIVE damp patch on one of our walls, when we opened our windows we found there were extensive roadworks going on outside the hoel day and night these were loud and made sleeping a difficulty.... lets talk about the breakfast.... very basic and not particularly tasty or enjoyable as we found most days we were going to get something else to eat before lunch time. whats worse... on our last night having been out for a meal arrived back at our hotel to find the front door locked, on looking inside we found there was nobody going about, decided to ring the door bell to try and grab somones attention was a waste on time and we had no other option but to wait over 30 minutes until the "casually" dressed security guard had been downstairs doing his laundry!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its fyne for a fun holiday !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: asifthe5th
Reviews.Content: I dont no what the people were complaining about , i went with 2 friends , the hotel reception wa nice , breakfast was ok for the price we was paying and im not going to lie the rooms looked a little dated but had a wide screen tv and i would giv it a 6/10 for cleaness!!!!! those who complained what did you exspect for the price????? there was no signs of bugs , it was great for what we wanted , just a place to rest are heads . Dont listen to the bad reveiws unleess you want to go with family or a non messy holiday ! x

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: L0na
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were looking at the reviews on Hotel Rokin and as I'm quite the girly girl and will not tolerate bugs I was very dubious about booking after the reviews. I was told however by my male companion to just suck it up as it was getting quite late for booking and I was lucky he wasn't making me stay in a hostel with 20 people to a room!!! So we booked it and on arrival was just in shock at how nice the place is!! Coffee and minerals machine in the reception and big couches as part of the bar! Straight away we were given our key by a lovely receptionist and got such a nice welcome. Sure the room was small but it was warm (it was snowing when we were there!), had 2 single intact beds with crisp white sheets and clean pillows (the throw was a bit shabby but you wouldn't need it as it's warm in the rooms), a spotless bathroom with the usual soaps and shampoos etc in it! Only complaint I had was that there was no key to our safety deposit bow but it was no hassle to have the passports in a handbag as that's all we were planning on using it for! You could come and go 24 hrs as long as you left your key with reception. Nothing was ever taken from our luggage which included iPods, cameras, memory cards! Breakfast was your usual continental with everything as fresh and tasty as you liked and no complaints there! We didn't take advantage of the bar so can't say much about that! Overall the hotel is great and more you can ask for given the price is reasonable! If you're looking for spacy bedrooms however go elsewhere! Rooms are cosy but with plenty of space to move around and store your luggage!! Besides what else do you use a hotel room for except sleeping, showering and changing?! No problems with noise, bugs, leaks, mould or anything else!! I have it booked again for my next trip in the summer!! Totally central to everything and very easy to find!! Book this hotel as long as you're not in need of a massive room!!

Reviews.Title: “Not acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: CM01110
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel i have ever stayed in. The reception was rude and swore many times at us in casual conversation. There were pubic hairs on our bathroom floor and a used condom outside out window. There were holes in the bed covers and the lighting was incredibly bad. At night it was incredibly hard to sleep with the loud noises coming from other rooms and very bad smoke smells coming from the corridoors. It was just not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “cordail hotel city centre”
Reviews.Author: gailsweetcheeks
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location just along from madame tusseuds right on the dam square very friendly helpful staff,, ,, but the good thing about this hotel is you can smoke in it,, without a problem,, a lot of hotels nowadays dont have smoking,, so i was more than delighted rooms are pretty basic , and could be doing with a bit of decoration but mostly down to being able to smoke,, would definately go back to cordial hotel and recommend it to anybody that wants to puff there lungs out breakfast was also good,, very clean maids came daily,with clean towels and made beds

Reviews.Title: “Not the best! 2008”
Reviews.Author: EuroTripDerby
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cordia, Reception staff were rude and very unhelpful kept sending us in the wrong direction. When we rang down to complain about a strange man sleepin in the hall way it took them nearly an hour to move him. Turned out he wasnt from the hotel and they had to call the police. It is a smoking hotel and the bed sheets had fag burns in them, the girl who came with me got bite marks all over her from what we can only assume are bed bugs. The rooms were exceptionally small! on the plus side beds were always straightened. Location was excellent and we were able to get about really easliy. The noise at night was really bad hardly got any sleep becausue of the trams and doors slamming. Overall if you like ruffing it and dont mind noise, rude staff and awful breakfast which comprised of cheese sandwidges and ham then go there! the location is awsome but that is all.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault it!!!”
Reviews.Author: clairelovett81
Reviews.Content: I was dreading going to this hotel after the reviews that I had read on Tripadvisor. I must say that I do not agree with any of the previous reviews. I was staying at this hotel in a group of 7 girls and must say that I have no major faults with the hotel. The rooms were adequate with good working showers, the staff were extremely friendly, the maids were very keen to clean the rooms and the location is ideal for getting around the city. The only complaint that I can say is that we were upset that the bar was not open (due to refurbishments!). Breakfast was contintental but fine, worth going to though as you see people stealing bread rolls for later!! And best of all none of us came back with bed bug bites!!!! An all round success I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see what everyone is complaining about!”
Reviews.Author: Lang0ustine
Reviews.Content: Well, after booking this hotel, I had a look on tripadvisor.com to see how other people had rated their experiences at this hotel. What insued was a mad frenzy of paranoia about bedbugs and fear that I had booked a horrible hotel. Upon arrival I was encouraged by the friendly staff, who didn't fail to impress once, even at 3am when we arrived back at reception enquiring about how to get to the Amsterdam Arena for our following days outing, the staff were friendly and helpful even drawing us a map. The rooms were quite small and yes the decor was slightly old fashioned but I was impressed with the modern and spotlessly clean bathrooms. None of the rooms had bed bugs, we had three rooms and 10 beds, not one had bed bugs, believe me, I checked thoroughly having watched countless videos and tutorials on how to spot them. Breakfast was basic, but for the price of the hotel we hadn't exactly been expecting a sumptuous feast. The location was good, the shops on one side, ten minutes from the main clubbing and bar area and of course the infamous red light district on the other side, which is a must see for anyone. All in all, we had a great trip, with the hotel being an excellent HQ for us, I would recommend this hotel to any groups of 18-25 year olds who want a good location, comfortable beds and somewhere to wash. If you are looking for luxury then perhaps this hotel is not for you but anyone with any sense would instantly recognise that due to the price of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: densmck
Reviews.Content: Had my stag at this hotel at the end of September, absolutely disgusting. Out of 14 people 9 of us came home badly bitten by fleas/bed bugs. Do not stay at this hotel, it is vile.

Reviews.Title: “Not keen on sharing!”
Reviews.Author: mustdrinkmore
Reviews.Content: The hotel does just what it says on the tin! It was clean, right on the main route into town, and easy to get anywhere however, I and all the rest of our group of 12 came home with more BUG bites than can be counted on all our collective fingers! I had 28 bites, my room mate 15! I dont believe this hotel can be like all the time, oh and there are huge road works going on outside with the mother of all jack hammers rattling away from 7am till . . . . We got back to the hotel at 6.30am and so didn't get much sleep but we weren't ther to sleep!! All in all it was OK, but dont take your wife for a romantic weekend! Good bar over the road does breakfast, great wet room!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: jackie-joey
Reviews.Content: the hotel is basic the bath room was spotless cleaner than ones i have known in france spain or greece (no mildew) the beds were clean and made every day and breakfast was orange juice rolls cheese and ham with tea and coffee which was layed up beautifully would stay there again and recomend it as its one of the most central hotels i have stayed in dam square is yards from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Did The Job.”
Reviews.Author: Pagan_Mojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic as you can tell from the 1 star rating. It is a good place to sleep and shower. The staff & food were ok and the room was cleaned everyday. The room was very small but as I said it was only a place to rest my head and for the money it was better than staying in a hostel :-) If you just want somewhere to crash then this is the place if your looking for luxury maybe you should be prepared to part with more of your cash!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: DeanoW
Reviews.Content: Just got back home (27th April 2007) after worst stay anywhere of my entire life. V unfriendly man at reception had a habit of making you wait whilst he was playing on computer - for crying out loud how difficult is it to get your room key!! The management who were chinese also did not offer any kind words and instead ignored guests. The room, or more like box was disgusting, dried blood on sink, I even squashed a few fleas, bed cover looked at least 30 years old, bed uneven, shower in toilet, constant smell of dope, poorly lit - seriously the list is endless. My room was also single glazed and with the major piling works (building new subway) going on right outside and recobbling of path - which was going on during the night I might add - this just added insult to injury. If I had extra cash I would have left immediately instead I had to slum it - you wont have to if you read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there. Really bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: seniorindian
Reviews.Content: The type of room booked and actually allocated were vastly different. Very unfriendly man at the reception. Did not accept the room and he would not refund the money. The rooms and linen were very dirty and looked used and not washed. Do not stay there. much better off anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe everthing you read”
Reviews.Author: grirgn
Reviews.Content: booking in this hotel was done prior to reading the reviews on this website, After reading these reviews I was dreading the trip all together. When we arrived at the Cordial we were surprised. The hotel was of a reasonable condition, staff very helpful and breakfast was good. The rooms were clean and although slightly small were more then enough for what we needed. price good, hotel good, location good. what more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “There is better for the cash!”
Reviews.Author: urbankhaos
Reviews.Content: I am a veteran of a dozen Amsterdam trips and I have to say that this is the worst place I have ever stayed at in this amazing city. The staff were OK-ish but the grubby, aged interior of the hotel definately rubs off on them and shapes their moods! It's central, cheap and not so cheerful. I would honestly avoid. For less money you can rent an apartment off Frederic.nl and he is the epitomy of what a stay in Amsterdam should be. Polite, jovial, warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: georfil
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights with my husband. The location is great, close to the shopping area, Madame Tussaud, the flower market etc. The rooms were small. We were offered to chose between 2 rooms, one that faced the street and was VERY small and another that faced a brick wall and was ok in size. We chose the second one because of the size and the quietness. In the street they build a metro station and there is a lot of noise at times. The breakfast was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “hated the cordial”
Reviews.Author: norma2712
Reviews.Content: Lifts to all floors, they forgot to mention another flight of stairs to the room which was very badly lit.Room was very small and dark looking out to a very dark alley.We have been to Amsterdam 7 times and this is the worst hotel we have ever had . Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: Crozzers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend with 6 other guys on a 40th do. The location is great for all that is Amsterdam. The actual room we stayed in was miniscule for two blokes and was in desperate need of a facelift .I cant understand why we had a tv that was LCD High tech 2006 yet the bed cover looked like 1966. As a hotel to crash in with blokes for the weekend it was merely adequate and I'm not even a fussy guy but I wouldnt take my missus here. We had a view overlooking the roadworks but didnt hear them at all to be honest. I had no problems with the staff in the minimal interaction i had with them and they did let us keep our cases in a secure location after checking out. The breakfast is a joke cheese ham and a roll that wouldnt feed a mouse. We had a glass of juice and went for a full English elsewhere. This hotel is merely ok as a place to crash when your out on the lash with your mates. The shower was good though.

Reviews.Title: “handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the hotel cordial for 3 nights is june, and it was just what we wanted. the location was great, although there was some building works going on, but that didnt bother us at all. just a short walk from dam and rembrandt square is was very handy!! the room was quite small but everything was clean and suited our weekend, we weren't expecting the ritz!!!!! would go back, although would prob stay in the red light district next time as that was so funny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mez1973
Reviews.Content: I have returned after a weekend away with the lads, and I have to say we had no problems whatsoever. Nice friendly staff, room was ok, and lets face it, in Amsterdam, you only need a room. If you are used to 4* Hotels, I would look elsewhere, but if you want a room with no frills, this is your place. Great location also, 2 mins walk to Dam Saquare, and about 10-15 mins from Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam with some friends last weekend and we had the misfortune of staying at the Hotel Cordial. There were 4 of us, 3 girls who shared a room and a male friend who had a room by himself. Both rooms were small and dingy. The girls' room stank of stale smoke on arrival (and the smell never really went away as if it had permeated the curtains and the carpet) and the view was non existant since it gave onto an alleyway and all we could see was the wall opposite. My male friend's room was hardly better because, although it gave onto the Rokin, it was very noisy due to the heavy works going on at the moment. The hotel is in dire need of a facelift as the whole place has a grubby feel to it which is very unpleasant. The staff are borderline rude and could hardly be called welcoming. You got the impression that they would rather be somewhere else (and who could blame them?!). The breakfast is OK but nothing special. Amsterdam is a fantastic city and I am sure there are many cheap-ish hotels available so my advice is to look elsewhere. I travel quite a bit and I find it really galling when hotels get away with poor service, like this one.

Reviews.Title: “dont do it!!”
Reviews.Author: dan_n_donna
Reviews.Content: do not book this hotel!!!! we reserved rooms for 11 people back in february for the weekend of 21st april for my brothers 21st birthday. we booked via a web site that was supposed to make it "easy to book" . we received confirmation emails to say our booking was complete. the booking agent rang us 2 days before departure to say that the hotel had cancelled the rooms due to a problem with the debit card number. i immediately phoned the hotel to sort the confusion and they told me the rooms were now cancelled and let to somebody else and they hung up on me!! the booking agent said they were not responsible for the hotels action and were unfortunately not able to find us alternative rooms. i was horrified and had to spend 8 hours on the wednesday before dpearture on the internet trying to find rooms for 11 guys for that friday. i eventually got a late cancellation at 11.30pm in a hotel 10km outside amsterdam instead of the central rooms we had booked well in advance during one of amsterdams busiest weekends of the year. the hotel managed to hang up on me and my partner and another booking agent trying to help us 4 times during the same day continually saying" your rooms are cancelled". they could have ruined what should have been a fab weekend and i was simply lucky through persistence to find them alternative rooms. leave this hotel well alone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sarah28Doncaster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at hotel cordial, 3rd visit to amsterdam. Just 8 mins walk from central station in an ideal location, (apart from building works but its unavoidable in amsterdam at present, but with the window shut through day it bocks out most of the noise. Only 2 mins walk from dam square, lots of eating and drinking places surrounding, shopping on the doorstep and lots of attractions only walking distance. We were given the choice of 4 different double rooms on arrival, we choose 4th floor, our room was clean, and nicely presented,could do with a lick of paint but its ok. In the room was a hairdryer, tv with some english channels,a walldrobe, dressing table and a large mirror. The ensuite was very small with just a shower and toilet, which were kept very clean and 4 towels were provided.Our room was cleaned during our stay and bed made. Breakfast was traditional dutch was served in a cosy breakfast room,comprising of cereal, bread rolls, ham, salami,cheese and boiled eggs, all fresh and nicely presented. The waiter kept filling our cups with coffee or tea when we were empty. I havent got any bad views of hotel cordial,for a budget hotel i found it excellent value for money. I will be booking to stay again on my next visit to amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cordial
HotelInfo.Address: Rokin 62 - 64, Amsterdam 1012 KW, The Netherlands
